fields.html: Welcome to The Bar.com. If you’re looking for beautifully smooth whiskies, award-winning gins or other world-class spirits to send as gifts, you’re in the right place.

fields.text: Nothing says Mexico like the Margarita, an elegant blend of tequila, fresh lime and orange, served in a salt-rimmed glass – and the last of the great classic cocktails.

fields.html: Nothing says Mexico like the Margarita, an elegant blend of tequila, fresh lime and orange, served in a salt-rimmed glass – and the last of the great classic cocktails. Try the classic method here, or blitz all the ingredients with ice in a blender for an easy frozen cocktail- which is great for parties!
Fill a cocktail shaker with cubed ice.
Use a jigger to measure 35ml Orange Liqueur, 50ml Tequila and 25ml lime juice to the shaker.
Shake until chilled. Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a short glass.

Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.

DRINKS CALCULATOR

fields.text: Nothing says Mexico like the Margarita, an elegant blend of tequila, fresh lime and orange, served in a salt-rimmed glass – and the last of the great classic cocktails.

Clean, pure blanco tequila with sweet grenadine and delicious, subtly sour orange juice makes one of the greatest of modern classic cocktails, a drink that has a surprising place in rock ‘n’ roll history.

fields.html: Clean, pure blanco tequila with sweet grenadine and delicious, subtly sour orange juice makes one of the greatest of modern classic cocktails, a drink that has a surprising place in rock ‘n’ roll history.
1 x Tall glass
1 x Jigger
1 x Chopping Board
1 x Ice
1 x Knife
Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blanco Tequila, 110ml orange juice and 10ml cranberry juice into the glass.
Cut a wedge of orange with a sharp knife on a cutting board and place on top of the drink to garnish your Tequila Sunrise.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.

fields.text: Clean, pure blanco tequila with sweet grenadine and delicious, subtly sour orange juice makes one of the greatest of modern classic cocktails, a drink that has a surprising place in rock ‘n’ roll history.
An unusual combination, but truly a delicious one, serve Blanco Tequila and cola with a squeeze of lime for a cool, refreshing mixed drink that your guests will love.

fields.html: An unusual combination, but truly a delicious one, serve Blanco Tequila and cola with a squeeze of lime for a cool, refreshing mixed drink that your guests will love.
1 x Tall Glass
1 x Ice
1 x Jigger
1 x Knife
1 x Chopping Board
Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blanco Tequila and 125ml cola into the glass.
Cut a wedge of lime with a sharp knife on a chopping board and place on top of the drink to garnish.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.

fields.text: An unusual combination, but truly a delicious one, serve Blanco Tequila and cola with a squeeze of lime for a cool, refreshing mixed drink that your guests will love.
Inspired by an island paradise, Moorea Volcano perfectly balances the sweet and citrus notes of Blanco Tequila with the fresh lemon juice and sugar found in homemade coriander syrup.

fields.html: Inspired by an island paradise, Moorea Volcano perfectly balances the sweet and citrus notes of Blanco Tequila with the fresh lemon juice and sugar found in homemade coriander syrup.
1 x Tall glass
1 x Knife
1 x Jigger
1 x Chopping Board
1 x Ice

Pour the lemon juice into a shaker. Add the coriander seed syrup.

This is made by grinding up coriander seeds, then mixing them with 1 part hot water and 1 part sugar.

Add the Blanco Tequila, Angostura bitters, dragon fruit juice and papaya purée.

The dragon and papaya fruits are native to both the French Polynesian Islands and Brazil.

Shake with a generous helping of ice.
This cools the cocktail and gives it an overall freshness.

Double strain into a tall glass. Straining helps remove any excess fruit pulp.
Garnish with lemongrass and papaya. This gives a fresh finish to the cocktail.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.

fields.text: Inspired by an island paradise, Moorea Volcano perfectly balances the sweet and citrus notes of Blanco Tequila with the fresh lemon juice and sugar found in homemade coriander syrup.

fields.html: Don Julio Blanco uses only hand-selected, fully matured and ripened blue Weber agave. The tequila is distilled in copper-lined pot stills, resulting in a fresh citrus sweet flavour.

fields.text: The classic tequila aroma: savoury, sage, and citrus.
Cristal clear. A high quality white tequila.
Refreshing sweet start, with citrus notes.
Smooth finish with freshly-ground black pepper notes.

fields.html: Don Julio Blanco Tequila comes in a stylish gift box, making it the perfect gift for tequila lovers. You can choose a gift card, which we can add a message to – if the gift is going direct to the recipient – or we can leave it blank so you can write it yourself if the gift is being sent to you.

Blanco Margarita


Style: A luxurious classic
Ingredients: 50ml Don Julio Blanco Tequila, 25ml fresh lime juice, 25ml simple syrup/agave nectar, a lime wedge.
Glass: Short ‘rocks glass’
Method: Combine Don Julio Blanco, fresh lime juice, simple syrup/agave nectar into a cocktail shaker with ice. If you don’t have a cocktail shaker, a jam jar or even your water bottle will work. Shake well. Strain over the glass. Garnish with the lime wedge.

Alcohol units: 2.0
How to make a simple syrup: 1 part sugar/ 1 part hot water. Stir to dissolve the sugar and let cool.

Don Julio González started his tequila journey in 1942. He started with nothing in his pockets but his own passion. He decided to establish his roots in Atotonilco by building La Primavera distillery, where he pioneered the world’s first ultra-premium tequila from 100% agave. He used only the highest quality blue agave, a spiky desert plant grown in the Highlands of Jalisco, Mexico.

Interesting facts

In Mexico tequila is often enjoyed as an accompaniment to food. It’s great served with ceviche, chicken tacos or even vanilla ice cream."

fields.text:
Event: Poll of the World's 50 Best Bars 
Award: No.1 best-selling tequila.

fields.html: This tequila is made using the finest blue agave plant and a time-honoured distillation process. It’s one of the best-selling luxury tequilas in the world.
